definition: variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc

sentences.english: I left my bag at grandma's house yesterday; I will go and get it when I am free.
sentences.chinese: 我昨天把手袋落在奶奶家了，我有空儿就去取。

sentences.english: Empty front-around enthusiastic pursuit of Ming ya, ya have turned her down.
sentences.chinese: 空空儿热情追求明涯，明涯十分困扰直言拒绝了她。

sentences.english: Leave a little more space between the rows.
Sorry, he is not available now. He's at a conference.
sentences.chinese: 对不起，他正在开会，现在没空儿。

sentences.english: There isn't any room on the bus.
sentences.chinese: 公共汽车一点空儿都没有了。

sentences.english: Students should learn to find time and use time properly so as to increase efficiency.
sentences.chinese: 学生应该学会抓空儿，合理分配时间提高效率。

sentences.english: As it turns out, Mrs. Franklin is not available on Tuesday.
sentences.chinese: 事情有所变化，弗兰克林太太星期二没空儿。

sentences.english: Have you had a chance to look at the report?
sentences.chinese: 您得空儿看那个报告了吗？

sentences.english: Cheryl is not free either because she will help him get the loan.
sentences.chinese: 谢丽尔也没空儿，她要帮他搞那笔短期贷款。

definition: older brother's wife/sister-in-law/(polite address to a younger married woman) sister
I/me/my/(often used in early vernacular literature)
